snippet: Apple has shut down one front in what Steven P. Jobs once described as a thermonuclear legal war against Android, Google's mobile operating system. But a wider truce in the patent battles engulfing the mobile industry is most likely still a long way...
abstract: Apple has shut down one front in what Steven P. Jobs once described as a thermonuclear legal war against Android, Google's mobile operating system. But a wider truce in the patent battles engulfing the mobile industry is most likely still a long way off, Nick Wingfield reports in Monday's New York Times.

headline.main: Daily Report: After Apple-HTC Settlement, Other Patent Fights Linger
